Package tests.sic.sST.nbin

tests.sic.sST.nbin package: implements exact and heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run exact average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing sporadic demands modeled as a compound Poisson process, and in particular the Negative Binomial process with Poisson arrivals and Logarithmic distribution of the quantities asked, with parameters λ and pl in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    sSTCnbin
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Negative Binomial process with parameters λ and pl (both positive).
    sSTCnbinBoxed
    the class extends the sSTCnbin class with the functionality that it projects any argument for evaluation into the feasible region of the class.
    sSTCnbinFixedTOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s and the order-up-to S variables, for given (fixed) review period T.
    sSTCnbinFixedTOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 5 double values.
    sSTCnbinFixedTOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of optimizing an sSTCnbin function, with a fixed review period T.
    sSTCnbinHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under compound Poisson demands modelled with the Negative Binomial distribution, by computing the optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* -which is usually done much faster- and then computing the optimal (s(t),S(t)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCnbinOpt
    class implements an optimizer over ALL three variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s, the order-up-to point S and the review period T.

Package tests.sic.sST.nbin Description

tests.sic.sST.nbin package: implements exact and heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run exact average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing sporadic demands modeled as a compound Poisson process, and in particular the Negative Binomial process with Poisson arrivals and Logarithmic distribution of the quantities asked, with parameters λ and pl in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

Package Specification

The formulae for the cost of such a system are computed based on the generic formulae in Hadley and Whitin (1963): Analysis of Inventory Systems.
